intro: Mentha arvensis var. parietariifolia, commonly known as the stone mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often found in dry, sunny environments such as cliffs and walls. The plant has square, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a serrated margin. Its small, pale blue or purple flowers are arranged in whorls along the stem. It is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
